description: This information is immutable after the request is created. Only the `request` and `usages` fields can be set on creation, other fields are derived by Kubernetes and cannot be modified by users.

extra.description: Extra information about the requesting user.

groups.description: Group information about the requesting user.

request.description: Base64-encoded PKCS#10 CSR data. The block should be either null or '`CERTIFICATE REQUEST`', and the content must be a X509 certificate request

signerName.description: Requested signer for the request. It is a qualified name in the form '`scope-hostname/name`'. The length of '`scope-hostname`' cannot exceed 253 characters and there is at least one dot (`.`) in the string. Each segment of '`scope-hostname`' when separated by '`.`' must be less than 63 characters. The '`name`' part must be a valid DNS domain name. If the field is empty for a kubelet client certificate, it is defaulted to '`kubernetes.io/kube-apiserver-client-kubelet`'. If the field is empty for a kubelet serving certificate, it is defaulted to '`kubernetes.io/kubelet-serving`'. Otherwise, it is defaulted '`kubernetes.io/legacy-unknown`'. Distribution of trust for signers happens out of band. You can select on this field using `spec.signerName`.

uid.description: UID information about the requesting user.

usages.description: A set of usage contexts the key will be valid for.
